data.title: Bruce Willis clutches Demi Moore in emotional new photo
data.meta_description: The family shared touching tributes to mark a major milestone for the Die Hard actor.
data.text:
Hollywood actress Demi Moore has posted an emotional tribute to her ailing ex-husband Bruce Willis to mark his 69th birthday.

Moore shared a photo of her perched on the arm of a couch beside Willis, who was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia in 2023.

WATCH THE VIDEO ABOVE: Bruce Willis and Demi Moore sweetly dance at home.

Know the news with the 7NEWS app: Download today

The candid snap appeared to be taken during a conversation they were having.

‚ÄúHappy birthday, BW! We love you and are so grateful for you ‚ô•Ô∏è,‚Äù Moore captioned the photo.

The second photo was of the Die Hard actor smiling lovingly at his grandchild Louetta, whom Willis and Moore‚Äôs oldest daughter Rumer welcomed in April 2023.

Moore‚Äôs third photo was a throwback of Willis smiling to the camera surrounded by their three girls, Rumer, Scout and Tallulah, who are now all in their 30s.

Fans were quick to react to the sweet post and admire their relationship.

‚ÄúTheir relationship is the sweetest thing ever ‚ù§,‚Äù one said.

‚ÄúThank you for providing a loving example of parenting even after divorce. ‚ù§Ô∏è You‚Äôre helping your children more than you know ü•∞,‚Äù a second said.

‚ÄúAbsolutely love how, even though Bruce and Demi are divorced, they love and respect each other as parents and grandparents ‚ù§üôå,‚Äù added another.

Moore also shared to her Instagram stories a video first posted by their first-born daughter, Rumer, 35.

The video can be viewed in the video player above.

Willis counts to keep his ex-wife on beat as they dance ‚Äúdown the hall‚Äù and their daughter laughs on.

‚ÄúThis is you in all your silliness and glory and I love it,‚Äù Moore said.

Meanwhile, Rumer also shared a tribute for Willis‚Äô 69th birthday, writing, ‚ÄúOh Daddio, to be loved by you is such a gift.

‚ÄúYou are the funniest, most tender, charming, out of this world silly, talented and magical papa.

‚ÄúLooking through these photos ... I am just filled with the deepest gratitude that we chose to spend this life together.

‚ÄúI am your first baby and, man, sometimes I wish I could be tiny enough to just cozy up on your chest again and laugh and cuddle you.

‚ÄúI love you so deep in my bones I don‚Äôt know how my muscles hold them.

‚ÄúYou are the greatest papa I could ever hope for.

‚ÄúThank you for your generosity, your silliness and heart.

‚ÄúLou (Rumer‚Äôs daughter) loves you so big.‚Äù

Rumer‚Äôs younger sister Scout, 32, said in her own social media post that ‚Äúdad is one of my best friends, perhaps now on a deeper level than ever honestly.

‚ÄúI cherish his affection and the immense freedom with which he‚Äôs always loved us.‚Äù

Willis‚Äô wife Emma Heming Willis, 45, also shared a sweet message, posting a throwback photo of the actor hugging one of their two daughters.

The couple has two children, Mabel Ray Willis, 11, and Evelyn Penn Willis, nine.

‚ÄúJust like you, we simply adore him. What you might not know, but maybe you could imagine, that being wrapped in his arms is the safest place in this whole wide world,‚Äù Heming Willis said.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a true gentle man. With so much love to give and share.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what I get to see, his true core. I can tell you, it‚Äôs so pure and ever so good.

‚ÄúHappy Birthday my love. You are the gift that keeps giving üíû.‚Äù

In 2022, the family shared that Willis had been diagnosed with aphasia.

But in February 2023, they said the disease had progressed to frontotemporal dementia, or FTD.

‚ÄúSince we announced Bruce‚Äôs diagnosis of aphasia in spring 2022, Bruce‚Äôs condition has progressed and we now have a more specific diagnosis: frontotemporal dementia (known as FTD),‚Äù the family said in a joint statement in February 2023.

‚ÄúUnfortunately, challenges with communication are just one symptom of the disease Bruce faces.

‚ÄúWhile this is painful, it is a relief to finally have a clear diagnosis.‚Äù

In a broader statement, posted to The Association for Frontotemporal Degeneration (AFTD) website, Bruce‚Äôs family explained more about the condition.

‚ÄúFTD is a cruel disease that many of us have never heard of and can strike anyone. For people under 60, FTD is the most common form of dementia, and because getting the diagnosis can take years, FTD is likely much more prevalent than we know,‚Äù they wrote.

‚ÄúToday there are no treatments for the disease, a reality that we hope can change in the years ahead.

‚ÄúAs Bruce‚Äôs condition advances, we hope that any media attention can be focused on shining a light on this disease that needs far more awareness and research.‚Äù
